name: 2-pyridineacetamide
Reason: 2-pyridineacetamide has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is acetamide, which has a melting point of around 10 degrees Celsius. The pyridine ring introduces additional rigidity and pi-stacking interactions, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The carbonyl group introduces a dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +30 degrees Celsius. The methyl group reduces the melting point by approximately -10 degrees Celsius due to the reduced molecular weight and the absence of a hydroxyl group.
